result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg Patrick Gogin 645779 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Greg Patrick Gogin 645779 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Greg Patrick Gogin 645779 was found guilty of Incest with Child [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders, Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • Greg Patrick Gogin 645779 was found guilty of 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "B" Felony], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • Greg Patrick Gogin 645779 was found guilty of Incest with Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Greg Patrick Gogin, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Sarah M Schmeiser.
Jeffrey D. Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Court denies motion for change of venue and to sever counts.
Jury trial set for 6/6/16 - 6/10/16. Court orders a jury questionnaire be sent out to 200 prospective jurors. Counsel to have the questionnaire sent to the Judge to review by 2/5/16. Judge will make a decision on the questionnaire by 2/12/16. Clerk to mail the jury questionnaire by 2/19/16 and have back by 2/26/16. Counsel will then review the questionnaires before the next court date. Atty. Kohl will file a notice on statements by the end of the day on 2/19/16. List of jury instructions to be filed by 5/18/16.  Case set for Status Conference on 3/16/16 at 9:00 am. and Final PTC set for 5/18/16 at 8:30 am.

records.addlTxt: To provide current address, current employer and employer address, and telephone numbers for himself and employer; to report any changes if the same within 24 hours to the Clerk of Courts.   NO CONTACT WITH: the victims A.C.G. and P.V.G. No contact with the victims places of employment and residences including any school residences. to not come within 100 yards of any place at which the victims are temporarily. No contact includes: no contact in person; no contact through letters; no contact through any electronic means of communication either directly or through social media network in which it can be reasonably expected the communication will be seen by the victims or conveyed to the victims.No contact through any third party except defendants attorney. No form of communication with any relatives or mutual acquaintances about the victims or the case under circumstances in which it can be reasonably expected the communication will be conveyed to the victims. No contact with the family residence at W6784 Rothenbuehler Road Monroe WI including the house, garages, any other buildings , any adjacent property and land and any other family owned Green County Properties. No contact with persons under the age of 18, except, contact with his minor sons if supervised by mother Marie or other adult she has approved if family court orders visitation.  Not to be within the  City of Monroe except to attend court hearings in which he is a party, or for scheduled meetings with his family case attorney. Mr Bestul. Defendant may travel to Monroe for previously scheduled Dr and Dental appointments. Defendant not to leave the state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court. Not to come within 100 yards of any private or public school premises, any state, county, city, village , or town park; any public or private daycare Centers or preschools, any public or private playground, swimming pool, tennis Courts or athletic fields or tracks held out for the use of minors. Any youth Center or community Center or community Center. Any locations where there are events occurring involving boy/girl club, scouting, 4H, or other child youth oriented organizations. Defendant to surrender US passport to the clerk of courts and not to apply for nor otherwise seek to obtain a replacment or duplicate. Defendant may have another party turn over his passport on his bahlaf.
